related_post.text: @Larswijn maybe..I mean this:One more interesting point to note\xa0:\xa0Logical\xa0and,\xa0or\xa0operators in Python returns an operand's\xa0value\xa0instead of a Boolean (True\xa0or\xa0False). For example:Operation\xa0x and y\xa0gives the result\xa0if x is false then x else yUnlike in other languages e.g.\xa0&&,\xa0||\xa0operators in C that return either 0 or 1.

comments: User discussed shortcircuiting and and added this bit of extra information
